basics.name: Alexandre St-Aubin
basics.summary: MSc student in Computer Science at The University of British Columbia. Research interests include Reinforcement Learning for Robotics, Computer Vision, and Lifelong Learning.

work.summary: Intermediate Algorithm Design and Analysis (CPSC 320). Hold weekly office hours and tutorials for 20-30 students. Coordinate a team of undergraduate TAs for test grading and program bi-weekly quizzes on PrairieLearn.

work.company: Mila - Quebec AI Institute, Complex Data Lab
work.summary: Worked under Professors Reihaneh Rabbany and Jean-François Godbout. Conducted research on the societal/political impact of deepfakes, focusing on the believability of AI-generated media. Evaluated state-of-the-art diffusion models to assess the quality and realism of generated images.

work.company: McGill University, Centre for Intelligent Machines
work.summary: Conducted research in long-horizon motion control of robotic arms supervised by Prof. Hsiu-Chin Lin. Developed a novel method for single-shot learning of manipulation tasks. Published: Single-Shot Learning of Stable Dynamical Systems for Long-Horizon Manipulation Tasks.

work.company: McGill University, Dept. of Mathematics and Statistics
work.summary: Engaged in a machine learning study and conducted a research project on Supervised Machine Learning guided by a graduate student.
Event photography across all Montreal Universities.
Honours Linear Algebra (MATH 251). Graded the assignments of honours students.

work.company: Institut de la Statistique du Québec (ISQ)
work.summary: Developed a VBA application streamlining survey estimation processes. Analyzed open-ended responses using word analysis programs. Contributed to provincial studies including the Québec Health Survey of High School Students and the Québec Survey on Tobacco and Vaping Products.

education.area: Master of Science in Computer Science
Joint Honours BSc, Mathematics and Computer Science

awards.title: NSERC Canada Graduate Scholarship-Master's
awards.summary: Held at the University of British Columbia. Amount: 27,000 CAD

awards.title: University of Waterloo financial support (Offer rejected)
awards.awarder: David R. Cheriton School of Computer Science
awards.summary: Master of Mathematics program. Amount: 29,000 CAD / Year

awards.title: Science Undergraduate Research Award (SURA)
awards.summary: Research funding for full-time research activities. Amount: 8,700 CAD

publications.name: Single-Shot Learning of Stable Dynamical Systems for Long-Horizon Manipulation Tasks
publications.summary: St-Aubin, A., Abyaneh, A. and Lin, H.-C. A novel method for single-shot learning of long-horizon manipulation tasks.

publications.name: An Introduction to Supervised Machine Learning
publications.summary: Report generated during the Directed Reading Program at McGill University.

projects.name: Adapting PAD to Trifinger Robotic Manipulation in Causal World
projects.description: A self-supervised Test-Time Adaptation framework that leverages an auxiliary Inverse Dynamics objective to update the agent’s encoder during deployment.

projects.name: TransCoPhy: Modernizing Causal Physical Reasoning with Transformers
projects.description: Explored the problem of counterfactual physical reasoning from visual input. Modernized the existing CoPhyNet architecture by replacing its RNN core with a Transformer.

projects.name: Network Interventions to Limit Misinformation Spread on Reddit
projects.description: Investigated network-based interventions to limit misinformation propagation on Reddit using the FACTOID dataset.

projects.name: Improving Drotrack
projects.description: Enhanced the performance of a 2020 drone-based tracking paper by implementing techniques like Kalman filters, optical flow, and ORB features.

projects.name: Applied Machine Learning Projects
projects.description: Emotion classification using LLMs, Regularization and model evaluation, Classification of image data with MLPs and CNNs.

projects.name: Image Deblurring
projects.description: Deblurred images by implementing convex optimization algorithms such as Spingarn's Method, Primal-dual Douglas Rachford Splitting, ADMM, and Chambolle-Pock in Matlab.
